data.title: NPC Store
data.solution:
money = raw_input()
price = raw_input()

my_money = map(int, money.translate(None,'GSB').split())
my_money = my_money[0] * 10000 + my_money[1] * 100 + my_money[2]
price = map(int, price.translate(None,'GSB').split())
price = price[0] * 10000 + price[1] * 100 + price[2]

if price > my_money:
  print money
else:
  left = my_money - price
  bronze = left % 100
  silver = (left / 100) % 100
  gold = left / 10000
  print "%sG %sS %sB"%(gold, silver, bronze)
data.statement:
You are in a MMORPG, and your money is in format "G S B", for example "10G 9S 32B"  where:
G = Gold
S = Silver
B = Bronze
1G = 100S
1S = 100B

You want to buy a new item from an NPC. Your goal is to print your money after buying the item. If you can't afford it, then print your current money.

Note: Inspired by "Game Money Converter" Puzzle by iArcadia. :D

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You are in a MMORPG, and your money is in format "G S B", for example "10G 9S 32B" where:
G = Gold
S = Silver
B = Bronze
1G = 100S
1S = 100B

You want to buy a new item from an NPC. Your goal is to print your money after buying the item. If you can't afford it, then print your current money.

Note: Inspired by "Game Money Converter" Puzzle by iArcadia. :D
Input
Line 1: Your money money in format "G S B".
Line 2: Price of the item you want to buy price in format "G S B".
Output
Your money in format "G S B" after buying the item.
Constraints
0 ≤ Gold ≤ 99
0 ≤ Silver ≤ 99
0 ≤ Bronze ≤ 99
Example
Input
0G 10S 30B
0G 9S 20B
Output
0G 1S 10B
